summary.para: A uniform resource identifier (URI) is a string that identifies (resolves to) a resource on the Internet—typically a file that is the destination of a hypertext link, although it may also resolve to a query or other entity. URIs are described in Internet RFC 2396, Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax.
A causes a URI to be resolved.

remarks.para: GemBox.Pdf detects the first change to and sets the as the current changing appearance of the .
The remains the current changing appearance of the until:

item.description: The is called on of the current changing appearance of the .
Another is changed, thus implicitly updating the current changing appearance and setting the newly changed appearance as the current changing appearance of the .
GemBox.Pdf determines that the current changing appearance should be updated such as when saving a to a file or cloning a or a .

remarks.para: To override this behavior, call method before and method after initializing the to take control of when the changed appearance is updated.

member.summary: Sets the license (serial) key.
member.param: The serial key.

remarks.para: You should call this method before using any other class from GemBox.Pdf assembly.
Key can only be set once (if you try to set another key, exception will be thrown).
The best place to call this method is from static constructor of your application's main class.
Valid serial key has multiple groups of alphanumeric characters, separated with dashes.
To use the assembly in free limited mode, use FREE-LIMITED-KEY as .
For more information about GemBox.Pdf evaluation and licensing, see evaluation and licensing.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Colors.PdfColorSpaceFamily
member.summary: Represents an enumeration of color space families of a PDF content.
member.seealso: Colors example

summary.para: (PDF 1.1) The device color space that controls the intensity of achromatic light, on a scale from black to white.
This color space is a singleton available via property.
(PDF 1.1) The device color space that controls the intensities of red, green, and blue light, the three additive primary colors used in displays.
This color space is a singleton available via property.
(PDF 1.1) The device color space that controls the concentrations of cyan, magenta, yellow, and black inks, the four subtractive process colors used in printing.
This color space is a singleton available via property.
(PDF 1.1) A special case of a single-component CIE-based color space, known as a CIE-based A color space.
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/CalGray dictionary].
(PDF 1.1) A CIE-based ABC color space with only one transformation stage instead of two.
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/CalRGB dictionary].
(PDF 1.1) A CIE-based ABC color space with two transformation stages.
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/Lab dictionary].
(PDF 1.3) A CIE-based color space based on a cross-platform color profile as defined by the International Color Consortium (ICC).
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/ICCBased stream].
(PDF 1.1) A special color space that allows a PDF content stream to use small integers as indices into a color map or color table of arbitrary colors in some other space.
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/Indexed base hival lookup].
(PDF 1.2) A special color space that enables a PDF content stream to paint an area with a rather than a single color.
For colored tiling patterns, this color space is a singleton available via property.
For uncolored tiling patterns, this color space can currently be created only with method from [/Pattern underlying-color-space-name-or-array].

(PDF 1.2) A special color space that provides a means for specifying the use of additional colorants or for isolating the control of individual color components of a device color space for a subtractive device.
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/Separation name alternateSpace tintTransform].
(PDF 1.3) A special color space that can contain an arbitrary number of color components.
This color space can currently be created only with method from [/DeviceN names alternateSpace tintTransform (attributes)].

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Marked.PdfContentMarkTagRole.OC
member.summary: Sections of content in a content stream (including a page's stream, a form's stream or pattern's stream, glyph descriptions a Type 3 font as specified by its CharProcs entry, or an annotation's appearance) may be made optional by enclosing them between the marked-content operators BDC and EMC (see 14.6, "Marked Content") with a marked-content tag of .
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.11.3.2 Optional Content in Content Streams'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Marked.PdfContentMarkTagRole.Artifact
member.summary: An artifact shall be explicitly distinguished from real content by enclosing it in a marked-content sequence with the tag .
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.8.2.2.2 Specification of Artifacts'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Marked.PdfContentMarkTagRole.TagSuspect

summary.para: In some situations, conforming writer may be unable to determine correct page content order for part of a document's contents. In such cases, tag suspects (PDF 1.6) can be used. The conforming writer shall identify suspect content by using marked content (see 14.6, "Marked Content") with a tag of . The marked content shall have a properties dictionary with an entry whose name is and whose value is Ordering, which indicates that the ordering of the enclosed marked content does not meet Tagged PDF specifications.
summary.note: This can occur, for example, if content was extracted from another application, or if there are ambiguities or missing information in text output.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.8.2.3 Page Content Order'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Marked.PdfContentMarkTagRole.ReversedChars
member.summary: The marked-content tag informs the conforming reader that show strings within a marked-content sequence contain characters in the reverse of page content order. If the sequence encompasses multiple show strings, only the individual characters within each string shall be reversed; the strings themselves shall be in natural reading order.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.8.2.3.3 Reverse-Order Show Strings'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Marked.PdfContentMarkTagRole.Span
member.summary: Marked-content sequences having the tag are also used to carry certain accessibility properties (Alt, ActualText, Lang, and E; see 14.9, "Accessibility Support"). Such sequences lack an MCID property and are not associated with any structure element. This use of the marked-content tag is distinct from its use as a structure type.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.8.4.4 Inline-Level Structure Elements'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.8.5 Standard Structure Attributes'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.9.2 Natural Language Specification'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.9.3 Alternate Descriptions'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.9.4 Replacement Text'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.9.5 Expansion of Abbreviations and Acronyms'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Marked.PdfContentMarkTagRole.Clip
member.summary: In Tagged PDF, all marked clipping sequences shall carry the marked-content tag .
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '14.8.4.5 Illustration Elements'

member.summary: One or more files may be associated with sections of content in a content stream by enclosing those sections between the marked content operators BDC and EMC (see 14.6, "Marked Content") with a marked content tag of .

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Patterns.PdfPattern

summary.para: Patterns come in two varieties:

item.description: Tiling patterns consist of a small graphical figure (called a pattern cell) that is replicated at fixed horizontal and vertical intervals to fill the area to be painted. The graphics objects to use for tiling shall be described by a content stream.

Shading patterns define a gradient fill that produces a smooth transition between colors across the area. The color to use shall be specified as a function of position using any of a variety of methods.

member.seealso: Patterns example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.7 Patterns'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Patterns.PdfTilingPattern
member.summary: A tiling pattern consists of a small graphical figure called a pattern cell. Painting with the pattern replicates the cell at fixed horizontal and vertical intervals to fill an area. The effect is as if the figure were painted on the surface of a clear glass tile, identical copies of which were then laid down in an array covering the area and trimmed to its boundaries. This process is called tiling the area.
member.seealso: Patterns example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.7.3 Tiling Patterns'

member.param: The associated with the .
The size of the cell.

Content Streams and Resources example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.7.3 Tiling Patterns'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Patterns.PdfTilingPattern.IsColored

summary.para: (Required) A value that determines how the color of the pattern cell shall be specified:

item.description: for Colored tiling pattern. The pattern’s content stream shall specify the colors used to paint the pattern cell. When the content stream begins execution, the current color is the one that was initially in effect in the pattern’s parent content stream. This is similar to the definition of the pattern matrix; see 8.7.2, "General Properties of Patterns".

for Uncolored tiling pattern. The pattern’s content stream shall not specify any color information. Instead, the entire pattern cell is painted with a separately specified color each time the pattern is used. Essentially, the content stream describes a stencil through which the current color shall be poured. The content stream shall not invoke operators that specify colors or other color-related parameters in the graphics state; otherwise, an error occurs (see 8.6.8, "Color Operators"). The content stream may paint an image mask, however, since it does not specify any color information (see 8.9.6.2, "Stencil Masking").

member.value: A value that determines how the color of the pattern cell shall be specified.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.7.3 Tiling Patterns'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Patterns.PdfTilingPattern.BoundingBox
member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers in the pattern coordinate system giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the pattern cell's bounding box. These boundaries shall be used to clip the pattern cell.
member.value: An array of four numbers in the pattern coordinate system giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the pattern cell's bounding box.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.7.3 Tiling Patterns'

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfContent.BeginEdit

summary.para: Begins editing of the .
Calling is optional for and is mandatory for any other that is going to be edited.

Call to commit the edited content and all resources (fonts, images, etc.) used by the edited content to the underlying content stream and the associated resource dictionary or to discard the changes and roll back to content specified in the underlying content stream.
If is called on a that is already being edited, the second and subsequent calls are ignored.

member.exception: The content is not editable. To edit 's content, use property.

remarks.para: Calling is optional for because GemBox.Pdf detects the first change to and implicitly calls which sets the as the current editing page of the .
The remains the current editing page of the until:

item.description: The or method is called on of the current editing page of the .
The of another is edited, thus implicitly calling on of the current editing page and on of the newly edited page which sets it as the current editing page of the .
The GemBox.Pdf determines that content of the current editing page should be committed to the underlying content stream such as when saving a to a file or cloning a or a .

remarks.para: To override this behavior, call method before and method after editing the to take control of when the edited content is committed to the underlying content stream.

member.seealso: Content Streams and Resources example

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfContent.EndEdit(System.Boolean)

summary.para: Ends editing of the by committing the edited content and all resources (fonts, images, etc.) used by the edited content to the underlying content stream and the associated resource dictionary.
Calling is optional for and is mandatory for any other that is being edited.
This method will be ignored if called on a that is not being edited.

member.param: If set to , forces the committing of the, potentially unchanged, content and all resources (fonts, images, etc.) used by the content to the underlying content stream and the associated resource dictionary.
member.seealso: Content Streams and Resources example

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfContent.CancelEdit

summary.para: Cancels editing of the by discarding changes since the last call and rolling back to content specified in the underlying content stream.
This method will be ignored if called on a that is not being edited.

member.seealso: Content Streams and Resources example

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfContentFormat.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets the formatting properties related to painting an area (filling).
member.value: The formatting properties related to painting an area (filling).

remarks.para: When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in the associated , but the data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of a set of formatting properties from one to another.
If value that is being set comes from a that is contained in another , this property setter will automatically clone all s (s, s, and s) contained in the and associate the clones with the current .
The is always applicable to , is applicable to and if is , and is not applicable to any other . The is, additionally, applicable to and .
If the is not applicable, then fill-related graphics state parameters won't be written when writing the associated to the underlying content stream.

member.seealso: Filling example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4 Graphics State'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfContentFormat.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text-related formatting properties.
member.value: The text-related formatting properties.

remarks.para: When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in the associated , but the data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of a set of formatting properties from one to another.

Also, when setting a value on a , the actual font and size (retrieved with method) remain unchanged because new font might not contain all the necessary information to correctly position, render and/or convert to Unicode all characters of the . As a workaround, set font and size directly by using method.
If value that is being set comes from a that is contained in another , this property setter will automatically clone all s (s) contained in the and associate the clones with the current .
The is applicable to and , and is not applicable to any other .
If the is not applicable, then text-related graphics state parameters won't be written when writing the associated to the underlying content stream.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfExternalObject

summary.para: An external object (commonly called an XObject) is a graphics object whose contents are defined by a self-contained stream, separate from the content stream in which it is used. There are three types of external objects:

item.description: An image XObject (8.9.5, "Image Dictionaries") represents a sampled visual image such as a photograph.
A form XObject (8.10, "Form XObjects") is a self-contained description of an arbitrary sequence of graphics objects.
A PostScript XObject (8.8.2, "PostScript XObjects") contains a fragment of code expressed in the PostScript page description language. PostScript XObjects should not be used.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.8 External Objects'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFillRule
member.summary: Represents a rule used to specify the interior of the PDF textual or geometrical content that is filled or is part of the clipping area.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFillRule.NonzeroWindingNumber
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the interior of the PDF textual or geometrical content by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where an outline of the PDF textual or geometrical content crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time an outline crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a PDF textual or geometrical content outline crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the PDF textual or geometrical content. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the interior of the PDF textual or geometrical content by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of outlines within the given PDF textual or geometrical content that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights
member.summary: Represents the font embedding licensing rights for the . Valid fonts must set at most one of , , or .

remarks.para: Embeddable fonts may be stored in a document. When a document with embedded fonts is opened on a system that does not have the font installed (the remote system), the embedded font may be loaded for temporary (and in some cases, permanent) use on that system by an embedding-aware application. Embedding licensing rights are granted by the vendor of the font.
remarks.note: Applications that implement support for font embedding must not embed fonts which are not licensed to permit embedding. Also, when embedding a font into a document, applications must not modify the embedding permissions and restrictions. In addition, applications loading embedded fonts for temporary use ( or embedding) must delete the fonts when the document containing the embedded font is closed.
remarks.para: , , and fields are mutually exclusive: fonts should never have more than of these fields set. Note that, if two or more bits are set, some applications could assume the least-restrictive permission indicated.
remarks.note: GemBox.Pdf ignores the , so it is the application developer's responsibility to perform the font licensing rights check. If in doubt, contact the font's vendor.

member.seealso: fsType field in the OS/2 and Windows Metrics Table

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights.Installable
member.summary: The font may be embedded, and may be permanently installed for use on a remote systems, or for use by other users. The user of the remote system acquires the identical rights, obligations and licenses for that font as the original purchaser of the font, and is subject to the same end-user license agreement, copyright, design patent, and/or trademark as was the original purchaser.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights.RestrictedLicense
member.summary: The font must not be modified, embedded or exchanged in any manner without first obtaining explicit permission of the legal owner.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights.PreviewAndPrint
member.summary: The font may be embedded, and may be temporarily loaded on other systems for purposes of viewing or printing the document. Documents containing fonts must be opened "read-only"; no edits can be applied to the document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights.Editable
member.summary: The font may be embedded, and may be temporarily loaded on other systems. As with embedding, documents containing fonts may be opened for reading. In addition, editing is permitted, including ability to format new text using the embedded font, and changes may be saved.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights.NoSubsetting
member.summary: The font may not be subsetted prior to embedding. Other embedding restrictions specified in , , , , and also apply.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontEmbeddingRights.BitmapsOnly
member.summary: Only bitmaps contained in the font may be embedded. No outline data may be embedded. If there are no bitmaps available in the font, then the font is considered unembeddable and the embedding services will fail. Other embedding restrictions specified in , , , , and also apply.

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFonts.GetFontFamilies(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns the collection of objects embedded as resources in the specified assembly at the specified location.
Read the Remarks for details about the arguments of the method for desktop and web applications.

member.param: The name of the assembly that contains the fonts.
The location of the fonts in the assembly.
member.returns: An of objects embedded as resources in the specified assembly at the specified location.

note.para: When you add fonts as resources to your application, make sure you are setting the <Resource> element when targeting .NET Framework or when targeting .NET Core with enabled WPF.
Otherwise, use <EmbeddedResource> element for the build action.
Also, make sure System.Windows.Application.ResourceAssembly is correctly initialized, if you want to format text that uses embedded fonts with or text formatting mode.

remarks.para: The following image shows an example of a Windows Console project structure with font files added as resources.
The Following table illustrates the various and values that you can specify to retrieve fonts from the above Windows Console project structure.

tr.td: Font resource files are in the root of the entry assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of the entry assembly.
Font resource files are in the root of the referenced assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of the referenced assembly.

The following table illustrates the various and values that you can specify to retrieve fonts from the above Web ASP.NET project structure.
Since ASP.NET assembly is actually a class library referenced from ASP.NET web server, must always be specified.

tr.td: Font resource files are in the root of the main assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of the main assembly.
Font resource files are in the root of the referenced assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of the referenced assembly.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch
member.summary: Represents the degree to which a font has been stretched compared to the normal aspect ratio of that font.
member.remarks: The field values correspond to the usWidthClass definition in the OpenType specification. The usWidthClass represents an integer value between 1 and 9 — lower values indicate narrower widths; higher values indicate wider widths.
member.seealso: Content Streams and Resources
Reading text info example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '5.7 Font Descriptors'
OpenType font file 'OS/2' table usWidthClass field
OpenType font file 'head' table macStyle field

member.summary: The ultra-condensed font stretch that represents 50% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.ExtraCondensed
member.summary: The extra-condensed font stretch that represents 62.5% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.Condensed
member.summary: The condensed font stretch that represents 75% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.SemiCondensed
member.summary: The semi-condensed font stretch that represents 87.5% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.summary: The normal font stretch that represents 100% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.SemiExpanded
member.summary: The semi-expanded font stretch that represents 112.5% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.Expanded
member.summary: The expanded font stretch that represents 125% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.ExtraExpanded
member.summary: The extra-expanded font stretch that represents 150% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStretch.UltraExpanded
member.summary: The ultra-expanded font stretch that represents 200% of the normal aspect ratio of the font form.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStyle
member.summary: Represents the style of a font as normal, italic or oblique.
member.remarks: The fields correspond to the fsSelection definition in the OpenType specification. if fsSelection bit 9 is set, font style is ; otherwise, if fsSelection bit 0 is set, font style is ; otherwise, font style is .
member.seealso: Content Streams and Resources
Reading text info example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.8.2 Font Descriptor Flags'
OpenType font file 'OS/2' table fsSelection field
OpenType font file 'head' table macStyle field

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStyle.Normal
member.summary: The characters are upright.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStyle.Oblique
member.summary: The characters are artificially slanted. The slant is achieved by performing a shear transformation on the characters from a normal font. When a true italic font is not available on a computer or printer, an oblique style can be generated from the normal font and used to simulate an italic font.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontStyle.Italic
member.summary: The characters are truly slanted and appear as they were designed.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfFontWeight
member.summary: Represents the density of a font, in terms of the lightness or heaviness of the strokes.
member.remarks: The field values correspond to the usWeightClass definition in the OpenType specification. The usWeightClass represents an integer value between 1 and 1000 — lower values indicate lighter weights; higher values indicate heavier weights.
member.seealso: Content Streams and Resources
Reading text info example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '5.7 Font Descriptors'
OpenType font file 'OS/2' table usWeightClass field
OpenType font file 'head' table macStyle field

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfForm

summary.para: A form XObject is a PDF content stream that is a self-contained description of any sequence of graphics objects (including path objects, text objects, and sampled images).

A form XObject may be painted multiple times—either on several pages or at several locations on the same page—and produces the same results each time, subject only to the graphics state at the time it is invoked.

member.seealso: Form XObjects example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.10 Form XObjects'

summary.para: Creates a that starts with the specified character index and is of the specified maximum width.
This method allows incremental breaking of a to s.
It is useful in the following scenarios:

item.description: The might contain a lot of text that would be broken in a lot of lines and you only want to draw some of those lines.
The might not fit to the available height. Then each line should be formatted and, if it fits to the available height, drawn.
The might have lines that should have different or be drawn in a custom location (for example, text contained in a non-rectangular area).

summary.para: To format the next , increment the by of the current , until is greater than or equal to the .
Use method to draw the .

member.param: The character index of the starting character in the .
The maximum width of a , provided in points (1/72 inch per point).
member.returns: A value that represents a line of that can be drawn with method.
member.exception: is less than zero or greater than or equal to the or is less than zero.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfImage.ColorSpace
member.summary: (Required for images, except those that use the JPXDecode filter; not permitted for image masks) The colour space in which image samples shall be specified; it can be any type of colour space except Pattern.
member.value: The colour space in which image samples shall be specified.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfImage.BitsPerComponent

summary.para: (Required except for image masks and images that use the JPXDecode filter) The number of bits used to represent each colour component.
Only a single value shall be specified; the number of bits shall be the same for all colour components. The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, or (in PDF 1.5) 16.
If is , this entry is optional, but if specified, its value shall be 1.

member.value: The number of bits used to represent each colour component.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfImage.ImageMask

summary.para: (Optional) A flag indicating whether the image shall be treated as an image mask (see 8.9.6, "Masked Images").
If this flag is , the value of shall be 1 and Mask and shall not be specified; unmasked areas shall be painted using the current nonstroking color.
Default value: .

member.value: A flag indicating whether the image shall be treated as an image mask.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfImage.ExplicitMask

summary.para: (Optional; shall not be present for image masks; PDF 1.3) An image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image (see 8.9.6.3,"Explicit masking"), or an array specifying a range of colours to be applied to it as a colour key mask (see 8.9.6.4, "Colour key masking").
If ImageMask is true, this entry shall not be present.

member.value: An image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfImage.SoftMask

summary.para: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A subsidiary image XObject defining a soft-mask image (see 11.6.5.2, "Soft-mask images") that shall be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity values in the transparent imaging model. The alpha source parameter in the graphics state determines whether the mask values shall be interpreted as shape or opacity.
If present, this entry shall override the current soft mask in the graphics state, as well as the image’s Mask entry, if any.

member.value: A subsidiary image XObject defining a soft-mask image.

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfImageContent.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the image content to a file with the specified path. Path must include file extension.
member.param: The path to which to save the image content.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.
member.remarks:
File extension that is extracted from the is used to create the appropriate class instance that is then passed to the method.
Following file extensions are supported:
Portable Network Graphics: .png
Joint Photographic Experts Group: .jpeg, .jpg
Bitmap: .bmp
Tagged Image File Format: .tiff, .tif
member.seealso: Export Images example

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineCap
member.summary: The line cap style shall specify the shape that shall be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.3 Line Cap Style'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineCap.Butt
member.summary: Butt cap. The stroke shall be squared off at the endpoint of the path. There shall be no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineCap.Round
member.summary: Round cap. A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width shall be drawn around the endpoint and shall be filled in.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineCap.Square
member.summary: Projecting square cap. The stroke shall continue beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and shall be squared off.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineJoin

summary.para: The line join style shall specify the shape to be used at the corners of paths that are stroked.
Join styles shall be significant only at points where consecutive segments of a path connect at an angle; segments that meet or intersect fortuitously shall receive no special treatment.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.4 Line Join Style'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Miter join. The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments shall be extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter—see 8.4.3.5, "Miter Limit"), a join shall be used instead.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Round join. An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width shall be drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pieslice-shaped figure shall be filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Bevel join. The two segments shall be finished with caps (see 8.4.3.3, "Line Cap Style") and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments shall be filled with a triangle.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfPoint
member.summary: Represents an x- and y-coordinate pair in two-dimensional PDF space. The positive x axis extends horizontally to the right and the positive y axis vertically upward, as in standard mathematical practice.
member.remarks: The user space coordinate system shall be initialized to a default state for each page of a document. The property in the shall specify the rectangle of user space corresponding to the visible area of the intended output medium (display window or printed page). The positive x axis extends horizontally to the right and the positive y axis vertically upward, as in standard mathematical practice (subject to alteration by the property in the ). The length of a unit along both the x and y axes is set by the property (PDF 1.6) in the (see Table 30). The default value of is 1/72 inch (1 point). This coordinate system is called default user space.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.3 Coordinate Systems'

Initial value: 1.0.

member.value: The stroke opacity.
member.remarks: A value of 1 specifies that the stroke is completely opaque; a value of 0 specifies that it is completely transparent.
member.seealso: Stroking example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4 Graphics State'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfStrokeFormat.Width

summary.para: Gets or sets the thickness, in user space units, of paths to be stroked (see 8.4.3.2, "Line Width").
Initial value: 1.0.

member.value: The thickness, in user space units, of paths to be stroked.

remarks.para: The shall be a non-negative number expressed in user space units; stroking a path shall entail painting all points whose perpendicular distance from the path in user space is less than or equal to half the line width. The effect produced in device space depends on the current transformation matrix (CTM) in effect at the time the path is stroked. If the CTM specifies scaling by different factors in the horizontal and vertical dimensions, the thickness of stroked lines in device space shall vary according to their orientation. The actual line width achieved can differ from the requested width by as much as 2 device pixels, depending on the positions of lines with respect to the pixel grid. Automatic stroke adjustment may be used to ensure uniform line width; see 10.6.5, "Automatic Stroke Adjustment".

A line width of 0 shall denote the thinnest line that can be rendered at device resolution: 1 device pixel wide. However, some devices cannot reproduce 1-pixel lines, and on high-resolution devices, they are nearly invisible. Since the results of rendering such zero-width lines are device-dependent, they should not be used.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.2 Line Width'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfStrokeFormat.LineCap

summary.para: Gets or sets the line cap style that specifies the shape used at the ends of open s (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.

member.value: The line cap style that specifies the shape used at the ends of open s (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.3 Line Cap Style'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfStrokeFormat.LineJoin

summary.para: Gets or sets the line join style that specifies the shape to be used at the corners of s that are stroked.
Initial value: .

member.value: The line join style that specifies the shape to be used at the corners of s that are stroked.
member.remarks: The is significant only at points where consecutive s of a connect at an angle; s that meet or intersect fortuitously shall receive no special treatment.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.4 Line Join Style'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfStrokeFormat.MiterLimit

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum length of mitered line joins for stroked s (see 8.4.3.5, "Miter Limit").
Initial value: 10.0 (for a miter cutoff below approximately 11.5 degrees).

member.value: The maximum length of mitered line joins for stroked s.
member.remarks: The limits the length of "spikes" produced when s join at sharp angles.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.5 Miter Limit'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfStrokeFormat.DashPattern

summary.para: Gets or sets the dash pattern to be used when paths are stroked (see 8.4.3.6, "Line Dash Pattern").
Initial value: .

member.value: The dash pattern to be used when paths are stroked.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4.3.6 Line Dash Pattern'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfStrokeFormat.IsAdjusted

summary.para: (PDF 1.2) Gets or sets a value indicating whether to compensate for possible rasterization effects when stroking a path with a line width that is small relative to the pixel resolution of the output device (see 10.6.5, "Automatic Stroke Adjustment").
Initial value: .

member.value: to compensate for possible rasterization effects when stroking a path with a line width that is small relative to the pixel resolution of the output device; otherwise, .

remarks.note: This is considered a device-independent parameter, even though the details of its effects are device-dependent.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '10.6.5 Automatic Stroke Adjustment'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfTextContent.TextTransform

summary.para: Gets or sets the transformation from text space to user space.

Text space is the coordinate system in which text is shown. Specifically, the origin of the first glyph shown by a text-showing operator is placed at the origin of text space. If text space has been translated, scaled, or rotated, then the position, size, or orientation of the glyph in user space is correspondingly altered.

member.value: The transformation from text space to user space.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.4.4 Text Space Details'

summary.para: Gets or sets the character spacing in unscaled text space units (although it shall be subject to scaling by the parameter if the writing mode is horizontal).
When the glyph for each character in the string is rendered, shall be added to the horizontal or vertical component of the glyph's displacement, depending on the writing mode.
Initial value: 0.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.3.2 Character Spacing'

member.value: The word spacing.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfTextFormat.HorizontalScaling

summary.para: Gets or sets the horizontal scaling that adjusts the width of glyphs by stretching or compressing them in the horizontal direction.

Its value shall be specified as a percentage of the normal width of the glyphs, with 1.0 (100%) being the normal width. The shall apply to the horizontal coordinate in text space, independently of the writing mode. It shall affect both the glyph's shape and its horizontal displacement (that is, its displacement vector). If the writing mode is horizontal, it shall also effect the spacing parameters and .
Initial value: 1.0 (100%) (normal width).

member.value: The horizontal scaling that adjusts the width of glyphs by stretching or compressing them in the horizontal direction.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.3.4 Horizontal Scaling'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfTextFormat.Leading

Initial value: 0.

member.value: The leading that specifies the vertical distance between the baselines of adjacent lines of text in unscaled text space units.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.3.5 Leading'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfTextFormat.Rise

summary.para: Gets or sets the rise that shall specify the distance, in unscaled text space units, to move the baseline up or down from its default location. Positive values of shall move the baseline up.
Initial value: 0.

member.value: The rise that shall specify the distance, in unscaled text space units, to move the baseline up or down from its default location.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.3.7 Text Rise'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfTextFormat.Knockout

summary.para: Gets or sets the text knockout parameter (PDF 1.4) that determines what elements shall be considered elementary objects for purposes of colour compositing in the transparent imaging model.
Initial value: .

member.value: If the value is , each glyph in a shall be treated as a separate elementary object; when glyphs overlap, they shall composite with one another. If the value is , all glyphs in the shall be treated together as a single elementary object; when glyphs overlap, later glyphs shall overwrite (“knock out”) earlier ones in the area of overlap.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.3.8 Text Knockout'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Content.PdfVisualContentElement.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the formatting properties applied to the .
member.value: The formatting properties applied to the .

remarks.para: This property always returns a new instance of a that points to data associated with this . This reduces memory footprint since simpler internal structures can be used to hold the data and execution time increase is negligible since Garbage Collector has a very good performance for a short-lived (Generation 0) objects.

When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in this , but the data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of a set of formatting properties from one to another.

Also, when setting a value on a , the actual font and size (retrieved with method) remain unchanged because new font might not contain all the necessary information to correctly position, render and/or convert to Unicode all characters of the . As a workaround, set font and size directly by using method.

If value that is being set comes from a that is contained in another , this property setter will automatically clone all s (s, s, s, and s) contained in the and associate the clones with the current .

member.seealso: Content Formatting example
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '8.4 Graphics State'

All coordinates used after the transformation are expressed in the transformed coordinate system.
summary.note: Before setting the , move into its own so that the transformation is confined to that and doesn't have any effect on s outside that .

member.value: The transformation from the new (transformed) coordinate system to the original (untransformed) coordinate system.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Content.Text.PdfBasicFont
member.summary: Represents a base class for a font contained in a . A font is represented in PDF as a dictionary specifying the type of font, its PostScript name, its encoding, and information that can be used to provide a substitute when the font program is not available. Optionally, the font program can be embedded as a stream object in the PDF file.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '9.5 Introduction to Font Data Structures'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter
member.summary: The CCITTFaxDecode filter decodes image data that has been encoded using either Group 3 or Group 4 CCITT facsimile(fax) encoding.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.4.6 CCITTFaxDecode Filter'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.FilterType
member.summary: Gets the value.
member.value: The value.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.K

summary.para: A code identifying the encoding scheme used:

item.description: Pure two-dimensional encoding (Group 4)
Pure one-dimensional encoding (Group 3, 1-D)
Mixed one- and two-dimensional encoding (Group 3, 2-D), in which a line encoded one-dimensionally may be followed by at most − 1 lines encoded two-dimensionally

summary.para: The filter shall distinguish among negative, zero, and positive values of to determine how to interpret the encoded data; however, it shall not distinguish between different positive values.
Default value: 0.

member.value: The code identifying the encoding scheme used.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.EndOfLine

summary.para: A flag indicating whether end-of-line bit patterns shall be present in the encoding. The shall always accept end-of-line bit patterns. If is end-of-line bit patterns shall be present.
Default value: .

member.value: The flag indicating whether end-of-line bit patterns shall be present in the encoding.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.EncodedByteAlign

summary.para: A flag indicating whether the filter shall expect extra 0 bits before each encoded line so that the line begins on a byte boundary. If , the filter shall skip over encoded bits to begin decoding each line at a byte boundary. If , the filter shall not expect extra bits in the encoded representation.
Default value: .

member.value: The flag indicating whether the filter shall expect extra 0 bits before each encoded line so that the line begins on a byte boundary.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.Columns

summary.para: The width of the image in pixels. If the value is not a multiple of 8, the filter shall adjust the width of the unencoded image to the next multiple of 8 so that each line starts on a byte boundary.
Default value: 1728.

member.value: The width of the image in pixels.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.Rows

summary.para: The height of the image in scan lines. If the value is 0, the image’s height is not predetermined, and the encoded data shall be terminated by an end-of-block bit pattern or by the end of the filter’s data.
Default value: 0.

member.value: The height of the image in scan lines.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.EndOfBlock

summary.para: A flag indicating whether the filter shall expect the encoded data to be terminated by an end-of-block pattern, overriding the parameter. If , the filter shall stop when it has decoded the number of lines indicated by or when its data has been exhausted, whichever occurs first. The end-of-block pattern shall be the CCITT end-of-facsimile-block (EOFB) or return-to-control (RTC) appropriate for the parameter.
Default value: .

member.value: The flag indicating whether the filter shall expect the encoded data to be terminated by an end-of-block pattern, overriding the parameter.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.BlackIs1

summary.para: A flag indicating whether 1 bits shall be interpreted as black pixels and 0 bits as white pixels, the reverse of the normal PDF convention for image data.
Default value: .

member.value: The flag indicating whether 1 bits shall be interpreted as black pixels and 0 bits as white pixels, the reverse of the normal PDF convention for image data.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfCCITTFaxDecodeFilter.DamagedRowsBeforeError

summary.para: The number of damaged rows of data that shall be tolerated before an error occurs. This entry shall apply only if is and is non-negative. Tolerating a damaged row shall mean locating its end in the encoded data by searching for an pattern and then substituting decoded data from the previous row if the previous row was not damaged, or a white scan line if the previous row was also damaged.
Default value: 0.

member.value: The number of damaged rows of data that shall be tolerated before an error occurs.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfDCTDecodeFilter
member.summary: The DCTDecode filter decodes grayscale or color image data that has been encoded in the JPEG baseline format.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.4.8 DCTDecode Filter'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfDCTDecodeFilter.FilterType
member.summary: Gets the value.
member.value: The value.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfDCTDecodeFilter.ColorTransform

summary.para: A value specifying the transformation that shall be performed on the sample values:

item.description: No transformation.

If the image has three color components, RGB values shall be transformed to YUV before encoding and from YUV to RGB after decoding. If the image has four components, CMYK values shall be transformed to YUVK before encoding and from YUVK to CMYK after decoding. This option shall be ignored if the image has one or two color components.

summary.para: Default value: if the image has three components; otherwise, .

member.value: The value specifying the transformation that shall be performed on the sample values.
member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.

remarks.para: If the encoding algorithm has inserted the Adobe-defined marker code in the encoded data indicating the value, then the colors shall be transformed, or not, after the DCT decoding has been performed according to the value provided in the encoded data and the value of this property shall be ignored. If the Adobe-defined marker code in the encoded data indicating the value is not present then the value specified in this property will be used. If the Adobe-defined marker code in the encoded data indicating the value is not present and value of this property is then the default value of shall be if the image has three components and otherwise.

Parameters that control the decoding process as well as other metadata is embedded within the encoded data stream using a notation referred to as "markers". When it defined the use of JPEG images within PostScript data streams, Adobe System Incorporated defined a particular set of rules pertaining to which markers are to be recognized, which are to be ignored and which are considered errors. A specific Adobe-defined marker was also introduced. The exact rules for producing and consuming DCT encoded data within PostScript are provide in Adobe Technical Note #5116 (reference). PDF DCT Encoding shall exactly follow those rules established by Adobe for PostScript.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008

summary.para: Decodes data encoded in an ASCII hexadecimal representation, reproducing the original binary data.
Parameters: no.
Decodes data encoded in an ASCII base-85 representation, reproducing the original binary data.
Parameters: no.
Decompresses data encoded using the LZW (Lempel-Ziv-Welch) adaptive compression method, reproducing the original text or binary data.
Parameters: yes.
(PDF 1.2) Decompresses data encoded using the zlib/deflate compression method, reproducing the original text or binary data.
Parameters: yes.

Decompresses data encoded using a byte-oriented run-length encoding algorithm, reproducing the original text or binary data (typically monochrome image data, or any data that contains frequent long runs of a single byte value).
Parameters: no.
Decompresses data encoded using the CCITT facsimile standard, reproducing the original data (typically monochrome image data at 1 bit per pixel).
Parameters: yes.
(PDF 1.4) Decompresses data encoded using the JBIG2 standard, reproducing the original monochrome (1 bit per pixel) image data (or an approximation of that data).
Parameters: yes.
Decompresses data encoded using a DCT (discrete cosine transform) technique based on the JPEG standard, reproducing image sample data that approximates the original data.
Parameters: yes.
(PDF 1.5) Decompresses data encoded using the wavelet-based JPEG2000 standard, reproducing the original image data.
Parameters: no.
(PDF 1.5) Decrypts data encrypted by a security handler, reproducing the data as it was before encryption.
Parameters: yes.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfFlateDecodeFilter
member.summary: The FlateDecode filter decode data that has been encoded using the public-domain zlib/deflate compression method, which is a variable length Lempel-Ziv adaptive compression method cascaded with adaptive Huffman coding. It is fully defined in Internet RFCs 1950, ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification, and 1951, DEFLATE Compressed Data Format Specification.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.4.4 LZWDecode and FlateDecode Filters'

summary.para: A code that selects the predictor algorithm, if any. If the value is 1, the shall assume that the normal algorithm was used to encode the data, without prediction. If the value is greater than 1, the shall assume that the data was differenced before being encoded, and selects the predictor algorithm. For more information regarding values greater than 1, see 7.4.4.4, "LZW and Flate Predictor Functions".
Default value: 1.

summary.para: An indication of when to increase the code length. If the value is , code length increases shall be postponed as long as possible. If the value is , code length increases shall occur one code early. This parameter is included because LZW sample code distributed by some vendors increases the code length one code earlier than necessary.
Default value: .

member.exception: Value is not according to PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Filters.PdfPredictorFunction
member.summary: Represents a predictor function that can be applied to or data to make the encoded data more compact.
member.remarks: and encoding compress more compactly if their input data is highly predictable. One way of increasing the predictability of many continuous-tone sampled images is to replace each sample with the difference between that sample and a applied to earlier neighboring samples. If the works well, the postprediction data clusters toward 0.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.4.4.4 LZW and Flate Predictor Functions'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfChoiceField.CommitSelectedValueImmediately

summary.para: (PDF 1.5) If set to , the new value shall be committed as soon as a selection is made (commonly with the pointing device). In this case, supplying a value for a field involves three actions: selecting the field for fill-in, selecting a choice for the fill-in value, and leaving that field, which finalizes or "commits" the data choice and triggers any actions associated with the entry or changing of this data. If this property is , then processing does not wait for leaving the field action to occur, but immediately proceeds to the third step.
This property enables applications to perform an action once a selection is made, without requiring the user to exit the field. If , the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.

member.value: If set to , the new value shall be committed as soon as a selection is made (commonly with the pointing device). If , the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.7.4.4 Choice Fields'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature
member.summary: A digital signature (PDF 1.3) may be used to authenticate the identity of a user and the document’s contents. It stores information about the signer and the state of the document when it was signed.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'
Digital signature examples
Digital Signatures in a PDF
Adobe Acrobat 9 Digital Signatures, Changes and Improvements

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Format
member.summary: (Optional) A name that describes the encoding of the signature value and key information in the signature dictionary. A PDF processor may use any handler that supports this format to validate the signature.
member.value: A name that describes the encoding of the signature value and key information in the signature dictionary.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Content

summary.para: Gets the content of the .
For public-key signatures, should be either a DER-encoded PKCS#1 binary data object or a DER-encoded CMS binary data object.

For document timestamp signatures, shall be the TimeStampToken as specified in RFC 3161 as updated by RFC 5816. The value of the messageImprint field within the TimeStampToken shall be a hash of the bytes of the document indicated by the ByteRange and the ByteRange shall specify the complete PDF file contents (excepting the value).

member.value: The content of the .
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.ContentsLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the (in bytes).
member.value: The length of the (in bytes).

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Date

summary.para: (Optional) The time of signing. Depending on the signature handler, this may be a normal unverified computer time or a time generated in a verifiable way from a secure time server.
This value should be used only when the time of signing is not available in the signature.
Example: A time stamp can be embedded in a PKCS#7 binary data object (see 12.8.3.3, "PKCS#7 Signatures as used in ISO 32000").

member.value: The time of signing.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Reason
member.summary: (Optional) The reason for the signing, such as ( I agree … ).
member.value: The reason for the signing, such as ( I agree … ).
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Location
member.summary: (Optional) The CPU host name or physical location of the signing.
member.value: The CPU host name or physical location of the signing.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Name

summary.para: (Optional) The name of the person or authority signing the document.
This value should be used only when it is not possible to extract the name from the signature.
Example: From the certificate of the signer.

member.value: The name of the person or authority signing the document.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.ContactInfo

summary.para: (Optional) Information provided by the signer to enable a recipient to contact the signer to verify the signature.
Example: A phone number.

member.value: Information provided by the signer to enable a recipient to contact the signer to verify the signature.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Locks

summary.para: Gets the set of s that specify what changes, made to the document after the signature was applied, invalidate the signature.
If the value is , then the signature does not specify a Reference entry.
To set the , sign the with a whose is not or use any method before signing on a that holds the signature.

member.value: The set of s that specify what changes, made to the document after the signature was applied, invalidate the signature.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8 Digital Signatures'

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature.Validate

summary.para: Validates the .
summary.note: This method validates only that the document has not been modified since the was applied. The signer's identity (its certificate validity and revocation status) is currently not validated.

member.returns: An instance of a that contains a detailed error information for the status of the signature validation.
member.seealso: Digital signature validation example

member.param: The algorithm with which to compute the hash.
member.returns: The computed hash of the bytes of the document indicated by the ByteRange.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureAppearance.SignatureValidLayer

summary.para: Gets or sets the validity layer used for 'Signature valid' and 'Validity unknown' states.
If this property is set to a non- value, then also property must be set to a non- value for Adobe Reader to show the run-time created signature validity icon.

At runtime, Adobe Reader replaces the with the dynamically created 100 pt x 100 pt layer that shows either 'Signature valid' icon or 'Validity unknown' icon, depending on the state of the signature validity.
Default value: .

member.value: The validity layer used for 'Signature valid' and 'Validity unknown' states.

remarks.note: Prior to Adobe Acrobat 6.0 (released in July 2003), signature appearances were manipulated at run-time in order to display the validity of the signature. The validity was shown as a graphic icon and with an additional, optional text message. The manipulated portions of the signature appearance were contained in , and . Beginning with version 6, Adobe Acrobat does not maintain support for signature appearances that can be manipulated, though legacy signatures with these appearances may continue to display correctly. Use of , , and is not recommended because support of these layers in future versions of Adobe Acrobat may be discontinued at any time. Some applications will specifically warn against the presence of signatures with these layers because, for conformance with various signed document standards, signature appearances should be static.

member.value: The transformation applied to the .

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureContent.GetHash(GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfHashAlgorithm@)

summary.para: Gets the hash over which the signature was computed, if the hash is contained in the ; otherwise, .

If the is a DER-encoded CMS binary data object and conforms to RFC 5652 Cryptographic Message Syntax, the hash is either the value of the encapContentInfo field within the SignedData (if eContent field within the EncapsulatedContentInfo is not empty, in which case is because the is in the format) or the value of the MessageDigest signed attribute (if present).
If the is a TimeStampToken as specified in RFC 3161 as updated by RFC 5816, the hash is the value of the messageImprint field within the TimeStampToken.

member.param: The hash algorithm that was used to compute the returned hash.
member.returns: The hash over which the signature was computed, if the hash is contained in the ; otherwise, .

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureField.Sign(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Initiate signing of a PDF file with a digital ID available as a file with the specified file name and the password protecting the private key.

The most common format for such files is a PKCS#12 file, which uses .pfx or .p12 file extension and is a password protected storage container for digital IDs containing the public key (Certificate) and the associated private key.
The name of the preferred signature handler to use when validating the signature (Filter entry) is Adobe.PPKLite, the of the returned instance is and the is set to the internally estimated size.
To finish the signing, call any of the . Next signing cannot be initiated before the current one is not finished.
The returned is set to the thus automatically updating the .
If your project doesn't target Windows platform, to use this method, make sure your project references NuGet package System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.
summary.note: If the is not , then the method re-signs the PDF file directly and the should not be called. This behavior enables delay-sign and re-sign scenarios.

member.param: The name of a digital ID file that contains the public key (Certificate) and the associated private key.
The password protecting the private key.
member.exception: This is not contained in the of this PDF document. -or- Signing/timestamping of the PDF file has already been initiated on some in this PDF document. Finish that signing/timestamping by calling any of the before initiating a new signing/timestamping on this .
member.seealso: Digital signature examples

The name of the preferred signature handler to use when validating the signature (Filter entry) is Adobe.PPKLite, the of the returned instance is and the is set to the internally estimated size.
To finish the signing, call any of the . Next signing cannot be initiated before the current one is not finished.
The returned is set to the thus automatically updating the .

member.param: The digital ID source that is either an instance of a with a private key or an instance of a .

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureFormat.PKCS1

summary.para: The shall conform to PKCS#1 standard and use SHA-1 digest method and the RSA encryption algorithm.
The certificate chain of the signer shall be stored in the 's Cert entry.
PKCS#1 signatures are deprecated with PDF 2.0.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8.3.2 PKCS#1 Signatures'
PKCS #1: RSA Cryptography Specifications Version 2.2

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureFormat.PKCS7

summary.para: The shall be a DER-encoded CMS binary data object containing the signature and conform to RFC 5652 Cryptographic Message Syntax.
The original signed message digest over the document’s byte range shall be incorporated as the normal CMS SignedData field. No data shall be encapsulated in the CMS SignedData field.
At minimum the CMS object shall include the signer’s X.509 signing certificate. This certificate shall be used to verify the signature value in .

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8.3.3 PKCS#7 Signatures as used in ISO 32000'
Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS)

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureFormat.PKCS7_SHA1

summary.para: The shall be a DER-encoded CMS binary data object containing the signature and conform to RFC 5652 Cryptographic Message Syntax.

The SHA1 digest of the document’s byte range shall be encapsulated in the CMS SignedData field with ContentInfo of type Data. The digest of that SignedData shall be incorporated as the normal CMS digest.
At minimum the CMS object shall include the signer’s X.509 signing certificate. This certificate shall be used to verify the signature value in .
PKCS#7 SHA-1 signatures are deprecated with PDF 2.0.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8.3.3 PKCS#7 Signatures as used in ISO 32000'
Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS)

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureFormat.CAdES
member.summary: (PDF 2.0) The shall be a DER-encoded CMS binary data object containing the signature, conform to RFC 5652 Cryptographic Message Syntax and follow one of two profiles denoted as PAdES-E-BES (Basic Electronic Signature) and PAdES-E-EPES (Explicit Policy Electronic Signature). These are defined to be compatible with the corresponding profiles defined in ETSI EN 319 122-2 (i.e., CAdES-E-BES and CAdES-E-EPES, respectively).
member.seealso: Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS)

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureFormat.RFC3161
member.summary: (PDF 2.0) Signature is a document timestamp. The shall be the TimeStampToken as specified in RFC 3161 as updated by RFC 5816. The value of the messageImprint field within the TimeStampToken shall be a hash of the bytes of the document indicated by the ByteRange and the ByteRange shall specify the complete PDF file contents (excepting the value).
member.seealso: ETSI EN 319 142-1, section '5.4.3 Document Time-stamp'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureLevel

summary.para: Represents levels of PDF Advanced Electronic Signature (PAdES) baseline signatures, intended to facilitate interoperability and to encompass the life cycle of PAdES signature.

The levels and are appropriate where the technical validity of signature needs to be preserved for a period of time after signature creation where certificate expiration, revocation and/or algorithm obsolescence is of concern.

level targets long term availability and integrity of the validation material of digital signatures over long term. The B-LTA level can help to validate the signature beyond many events that limit its validity (for instance, the weakness of used cryptographic algorithms, or expiration of validation data). The use of B-LTA level is considered an appropriate preservation and transmission technique for signed data.

member.seealso: PAdES baseline signatures
Extended PAdES signature profiles
PDF Advanced Electronic Signature (PAdES) examples

summary.para: Profile for CMS digital signatures in PDF (see also legacy PDF Advanced Electronic Signature Basic based on ISO 32000-1) is under this level.
must satisfy the following requirements:

item.description: must be either or .

summary.para: PDF Advanced Electronic Signature baseline signature B-B level.
B-B level provides requirements for the incorporation of signed and some unsigned attributes when the signature is generated.

The main requirement is the protection of the signing certificate by the signature itself (the signing certificate digest is incorporated as part of a signed attribute to the signature). This allows to counter the certificate substitution attack.

The main requirement is also present in extended levels: PAdES Enhanced Basic Electronic Signature (PAdES-E-BES and legacy PAdES-E-BES) and PAdES Enhanced Explicit Policy Electronic Signature (PAdES-E-EPES and legacy PAdES-E-EPES).
must satisfy the following requirements:

item.description: must be .
cannot contain any CRL or OCSP response.
cannot be .
If is not , then must be .

summary.para: PDF Advanced Electronic Signature baseline signature B-T level.

B-T level, in addition to B-B level requirements, provides requirements for the generation and inclusion (for an existing signature) of a trusted token proving that the signature itself actually existed at a certain date and time.

Generated timestamp token is either incorporated as a part of a signed attribute to the signature or included (for an existing signature) as a content of a signature dictionary (whose Type entry has a value of DocTimeStamp) that is a value of a signature field added as an incremental update.
must satisfy the following requirements:

item.description: must be .
cannot contain any CRL or OCSP response.
cannot be .
If is not , then must be .
cannot be .

summary.para: PDF Advanced Electronic Signature baseline signature B-LT level.

B-LT level, in addition to B-T level requirements, provides requirements for the incorporation of all the material required for validating the signature in the signature document. This level aims to tackle the long term availability of the validation material.
Validation related information (VRI) for a signature includes:

item.description: The full set of certificates, including the trust anchor when it is available in the form of a certificate, that have been used to validate the signature and which are not already present. This set includes certificates required for validating the signing certificate, for validating any attribute certificate present in the signature, and for validating any time-stamp token's signing certificate (i.e. a TSA certificate) already incorporated to the signature.

The full set of revocation data (CRL or OCSP responses) that have been used in the validation of the signer and CA certificates used in signature. This set includes all certificate status information required for validating the signing certificate, for validating any attribute certificate present in the signature, and for validating any time-stamp token's signing certificate (i.e. a TSA certificate) already incorporated to the signature.

summary.para: This information is stored in a Document Security Store (DSS) dictionary.
must satisfy the following requirements:

item.description: must be .
cannot contain any CRL or OCSP response.
cannot be .
If is not , then must be .
cannot be .

summary.para: PDF Advanced Electronic Signature baseline signature B-LTA level.

B-LTA level, in addition to B-LT level requirements, provides requirements for the incorporation of electronic time-stamps that allow validation of the signature long time after its generation. This level aims to tackle the long term availability and integrity of the validation material.

Validation related information (VRI) is stored in a Document Security Store (DSS) dictionary and generated timestamp token is included as a content of a signature dictionary (whose Type entry has a value of DocTimeStamp) that is a value of a signature field added as an incremental update.
This requirement is also present in the extended level PAdES Enhanced Long Term Validation (PAdES-E-LTV and legacy PAdES-E-LTV).
must satisfy the following requirements:

item.description: must be .
cannot contain any CRL or OCSP response.
cannot be .
If is not , then must be .
cannot be .

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureLock

summary.para: Specifies what changes, made to the document after the signature was applied, invalidate the signature.

The is specified by a certification signature (also known as an author signature) (PDF 1.5) which shall be the value of the first signed field in the document. It enables the author to specify what changes made to the document invalidate the author's signature.

The is specified by either a certification signature or a regular, approval signature (also known as a recipient signature). It enables the signer to specify a set of form fields whose change invalidate the signature.
Other set of changes, such as those that invalidate a usage rights signature or an FDF file signature (the Identity transform method), are currently not exposed because they are deprecated.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8.2 Transform Methods'
Adobe Acrobat 9 Digital Signatures, Changes and Improvements

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureLockedFieldCollection.Permission

summary.para: (Optional; PDF 2.0) The access permissions granted for this document. Valid values shall be:

item.description: - No changes to the document are permitted; any change to the document shall invalidate the signature.
- Permitted changes shall be filling in forms, instantiating page templates, andsigning; other changes shall invalidate the signature.
- Permitted changes are the same as for , as well as annotation creation, deletion, and modification; other changes shall invalidate the signature.

summary.para: The default value, , shall result in no effect on signature validation rules.

If the is already in effect from an earlier incremental save section or the original part of the document (via ), the value shall specify permission less than or equal to the permission already in effect based on signatures earlier in the document. That is, permission can be denied but not added. If the value specifies greater permission than a value already in effect, the new value is ignored.
If the document does not have an author signature ( is ), the initial permission in effect is those based on the .
The new permission applies to any incremental changes to the document following the signature of which this is part.

member.value: The access permissions granted for this document.
member.seealso: Adobe Acrobat 9 Digital Signatures, Changes and Improvements

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSigner.#ctor(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with a digital ID available as a file with the specified file name and the password protecting the private key.

The most common format for such files is a PKCS#12 file, which uses .pfx or .p12 file extension and is a password protected storage container for digital IDs containing the public key (Certificate) and the associated private key.

member.param: The name of a digital ID file that contains the public key (Certificate) and the associated private key.
The password protecting the private key.
