member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSigner.SignatureLevel

summary.para: Gets or sets the level of the PDF Advanced Electronic Signature (PAdES) that signature created by this signer must satisfy.
Default value: .
If is set to:

item.description: or higher, then must be , must be specified, and cannot both be specified and , if specified, cannot contain any CRL or OCSP response (because this information is added to the signature as 'adbe-revocationInfoArchival' signed attribute which or higher doesn't allow).
or higher, then must be specified.
or higher, then check that validation data is added to the security store is not performed since that can be done only after signing finishes.

or higher, then check that validation data is added to the security store and that validation data is protected by document timestamp is not performed since that can be done only after signing finishes.

member.value: The level of the PDF Advanced Electronic Signature that signature created by this signer must satisfy.
member.exception: One of the conditions specified in the description of this member is not satisfied.
member.seealso: PDF Advanced Electronic Signature (PAdES) examples

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSigner.AuthorPermission

summary.para: Gets or sets the permitted actions after certifying the document with this .
If set to a value, then the signature created by this is a regular, approval signature (also known as a recipient signature).

Otherwise, the signature created by this is a certification signature (also known as an author signature) (PDF 1.5). A document can contain only one signature field that contains a certification signature; it shall be the first signed field in the document. It enables the author to specify what changes shall be permitted to be made to the document and what changes invalidate the author's signature. The in any of the shall indicate the author's specification of which changes to the document will invalidate the signature. These changes to the document shall also be prevented if the is referred from the property. A value of indicates that the document shall be final; that is, any changes shall invalidate the signature. The values and shall permit modifications that are appropriate for form field or comment workflows. Setting the value to any other is not supported and throws .
Default value: .

member.value: The permitted actions after certifying the document with this .
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8.2.2 DocMDP'

summary.note: This property supports the GemBox product infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.value: The estimated length of the entry (in bytes) that should be large enough to contain the entire data returned by the method.

member.param: The PDF file stream (without entry) for which the signature should be computed.
member.returns: The signature that will be set as the value of the entry.

remarks.para: If both and are not specified, then image size will be equal to the slide size.
If only one of the or is specified, then the specified dimension will be respected and other dimension will be calculated so that original aspect ratio is maintained.
If both and are specified, then both specified dimensions will be respected (which may result in non-uniformly scaled image, if aspect ratio is not equal to the original one.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.PdfCrossReferenceType
member.summary: Represents how cross-reference information (information about byte positions of the indirect objects) and indirect objects are stored in the PDF file.

summary.para: Cross-reference information is stored as a list of cross-reference entries in a fixed format directly after all indirect objects and before PDF file trailer.
Use this option if file size is not an issue and you want to achieve the maximum portability of the PDF file.

(PDF 1.5) Cross-reference information is stored compactly in the cross-reference stream that is usually compressed and indirect objects can be stored compactly in object streams that are also usually compressed.

Use this option if file size is an issue and PDF file won't be opened by old PDF applications that do not support PDF version 1.5 such as Acrobat Reader or Adobe Acrobat before version 6.0 that support PDF version 1.5 and were released on July 2003.

member.summary: Enumerates the allowed syntactic forms for specifying a destination explicitly in a PDF file.

summary.para: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom.
Parameters: , and
This value corresponds to value XYZ from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.
Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically.
Parameters: none.
This value corresponds to value Fit from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.

Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.
Parameters: .
This value corresponds to value FitH from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.

Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.
Parameters: .
This value corresponds to value FitV from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.

Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.
Parameters: , , and .
This value corresponds to value FitR from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.
(PDF 1.1) Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.
Parameters: none.
This value corresponds to value FitB from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.

(PDF 1.1) Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window.
Parameters: .
This value corresponds to value FitBH from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.

(PDF 1.1) Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window.
Parameters: .
This value corresponds to value FitBV from PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.2.2 Explicit Destinations'.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfDocument.Id

summary.para: (Required if an Encrypt entry is present in the file trailer; optional otherwise; PDF 1.1) An array of two byte-strings constituting a file identifier (see 14.4, "File Identifiers") for the file.
Because the entries are not encrypted it is possible to check the key to assure that the correct file is being accessed without decrypting the file.
Although this entry is optional, its absence might prevent the file from functioning in some workflows that depend on files being uniquely identified.

member.value: The array of two byte-strings constituting a file identifier for the file.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.5.5 File Trailer'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfDocument.Version
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The version of the PDF specification to which the document conforms (for example, 1.4) if later than the version specified in the file’s header (see 7.5.2, "File Header"). If the header specifies a later version, or if this entry is absent, the document shall conform to the version specified in the header. This entry enables a conforming writer to update the version using an incremental update; see 7.5.6, "Incremental Updates".
member.value: The version of the PDF specification to which the document conforms (for example, 1.4) if later than the version specified in the file’s header (see 7.5.2, "File Header").

Embedded Files example

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfEmbeddedFile.CheckSum

summary.para: (Optional) A 16-byte array that is the checksum of the bytes of the uncompressed embedded file. The checksum shall be calculated by applying the standard MD5 message-digest algorithm (described in Internet RFC 1321, The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm) to the bytes of the embedded file stream.
summary.note: This is strictly a checksum, and is not used for security purposes.

member.value: A 16-byte array that is the checksum of the bytes of the uncompressed embedded file.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.4 Embedded File Streams'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification

summary.para: Represents a full file specification that might include information related to one or more specific file systems with which a PDF file can refer to the contents of another file (PDF 1.1).

A file specification shall refer to a file external to the PDF file or to a file embedded within the referring PDF file, allowing its contents to be stored or transmitted along with the PDF file. The file is considered external to the PDF file in either case.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.3 File Specification Dictionaries'
Embedded Files example

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification.IsUrl

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the URL file system shall be used to interpret this file specification.

When the property in a has the value , the value of the property in that is not a file specification string, but a uniform resource locator (URL) of the form defined in Internet RFC 3986, Uniform Resource Locators.
Default value: .

member.value: if the URL file system shall be used to interpret this file specification; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The URL shall adhere to the character-encoding requirements specified in RFC 3986. Because 7-bit U.S. ASCII is a strict subset of , this value shall also be considered to be in that encoding.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.3 File specification dictionaries'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.5 URL Specifications'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the file specification string of the form described in 7.11.2, "File Specification Strings", or (if the is ) a uniform resource locator, as described in 7.11.5, "URL Specifications".
member.value: The file specification string, or (if the is ) a uniform resource locator.

remarks.para: GemBox.Pdf tries to get this value from the following entries:

item.description: On Mac OS system: UF, F, Mac, DOS, Unix.
On UNIX system: UF, F, Unix, DOS, Mac.
On DOS and all other systems: UF, F, DOS, Mac, Unix.

remarks.para: UF entry is decoded using either or encoding and all other entries (F, DOS, Mac, Unix) are decoded using encoding.
GemBox.Pdf sets the following entries:

item.description: UF entry encoded either with or encoding for cross-platform and cross-language compatibility.
F entry encoded with encoding for backwards compatibility.
DOS, Mac and Unix entries are removed because they are obsolescent and should not be used by conforming writers.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.3 File specification dictionaries'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.2 File Specification Strings'
PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.5 URL Specifications'

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfFileSpecification.IsVolatile

summary.para: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A flag indicating whether the file referenced by the file specification is volatile (changes frequently with time). If the value is , applications shall not cache a copy of the file. For example, a movie annotation referencing a URL to a live video camera could set this flag to to notify the conforming reader that it should re-acquire the movie each time it is played.
Default value: .

member.value: A flag indicating whether the file referenced by the file specification is volatile (changes frequently with time).
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '7.11.3 File specification dictionaries'

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfCertificate
member.summary: Represents an X.509 certificate sent to others so that they can verify your digital signature with a public key contained in the certificate.

remarks.para: GemBox.Pdf doesn't use class to represent a certificate because creates a file that holds the certificate with the public key (in various locations on a hard drive) and on some operating systems and platforms that file is not deleted unless method is called. This creation of a file prevents usages of certificates in Medium Trust.

Another reason why GemBox.Pdf abstracts a certificate with a class instead of using directly is to enable different implementations of a certificate. For example, either implementation from .NET or Org.BouncyCastle.X509.X509Certificate implementation from Bouncy Castle could be used.

member.seealso: RFC 5280: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile
Digital signature examples

summary.para: Represents a digital ID used to delay-sign (deferred-sign) or re-sign a PDF file.
A does not perform the actual signing because it contains only a (with a public key) and no private key. Instead, a is used in the following process:

item.description: Delay-sign a PDF file by using the method followed by any of the methods. The property must be and after the signing is done, the property contains the hash of the (delay-)signed PDF file. The content of the delay-signed signature is empty (a sequence of bytes whose value is zero), thus the signature is not valid. But the signature content is replaced with the valid signature content when re-signing the PDF file.
Sign the using an external signer.

Re-sign the PDF file by using the method on the same on which delay-sign was performed (the method should not be called after as explained in the note of the method). The property must be set to a value returned by the external signer and after the signing is done, the property contains the hash of the re-signed PDF file (that should be the same as the hash of the delay-signed PDF file).

summary.para: The instances used in the delay-sign and re-sign should have equal properties so that the signature content created by re-signing fits into the delay-signed signature content that it replaces.

Delay-signing is also possible with method, but then you must take care to provide the appropriate value of the estimatedSignatureContentsLength parameter that should be large enough to contain the entire signature content created when re-signing the PDF file. If the is not available when performing the delay-sign, then delay-signing must be done by using the method. The first parameter of that method should return an array of bytes whose value is zero of the estimatedSignatureContentsLength length. Note that if is not , then delay-signing with method is difficult because hash provided to the external signer is not as explained in the Message Digest Calculation Process.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfDigitalId

summary.para: A digital ID used to sign and encrypt documents.
The certificate that comes with your digital ID is sent to others so that they can verify your signature.
The most secure digital IDs are issued by trusted Certificate authorities and are based on secure devices like smart card or token. Some are based on files.

remarks.para: GemBox.Pdf doesn't use class to represent a digital ID because creates a file that holds the private key and another file that holds the certificate with the public key (in various locations on a hard drive) and on some operating systems and platforms those files are not deleted unless method is called. This creation of files prevents usages of digital IDs in Medium Trust.

Another reason why GemBox.Pdf abstracts a digital ID with a class instead of using directly is to enable different implementations of a digital ID. For example, either implementation from .NET or Org.BouncyCastle.X509.X509Certificate with Org.BouncyCastle.Crypto.AsymmetricKeyParameter (private key) implementation from Bouncy Castle could be used.

Lastly, GemBox.Pdf abstracts a digital ID with a class to enable usage of signers for which private key parameters cannot be exported into .NET or Bouncy Castle implementation. These are, for example, Hardware Security Module (HSM), USB token, smart card or a web service and their functionality is called when overriding method.

member.seealso: Digital signature examples
External digital signature example

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfDocumentSecurityStore.AddValidationInfo(GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignature)

summary.para: Adds certificates, certificate revocation lists and Online Certificate Status Protocol responses for the specified to this .

The full set of certificates, including the trust anchor when it is available in the form of a certificate, used to validate the signature and which are not already present in the signature are added to the security store. This set includes certificates required for validating the signing certificate, for validating any attribute certificate present in the signature, and for validating any time-stamp token's signing certificate (i.e. a TSA certificate) already incorporated to the signature.

The full set of revocation data (CRL or OCSP responses) used in the validation of the signer and CA certificates used in signature are added to the security store. This set includes all certificate status information required for validating the signing certificate, for validating any attribute certificate present in the signature, and for validating any time-stamp token's signing certificate (i.e. a TSA certificate) already incorporated to the signature.

member.param: The signature whose certificates, certificate revocation lists and Online Certificate Status Protocol responses are added to this .
member.seealso: PAdES B-LTA level example

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfDocumentSecurityStore.AddValidationInfo(GemBox.Pdf.Forms.PdfSignatureValidationInfo)
member.summary: Adds certificates, certificate revocation lists and Online Certificate Status Protocol responses from the specified to this .
member.param: The signature validation-related information whose certificates, certificate revocation lists and Online Certificate Status Protocol responses are added to this .
member.remarks: If certificate already exists in the , it is not added.
member.seealso: PAdES B-LT level example

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4
member.summary: A proprietary encryption algorithm known as RC4. RC4 is a symmetric stream cipher: the same algorithm shall be used for both encryption and decryption, and the algorithm does not change the length of the data.

summary.para: The AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) algorithm (beginning with PDF 1.6). AES is a symmetric block cipher: the same algorithm shall be used for both encryption and decryption, and the length of the data when encrypted is rounded up to a multiple of the block size, which is fixed to always be 16 bytes, as specified in FIPS 197, Advanced Encryption Standard (AES).

Strings and streams encrypted with AES shall use a padding scheme that is described in Internet RFC 2898, PKCS #5: Password-Based Cryptography Specification Version 2.0. For an original message length of M, the pad shall consist of 16 - (M mod 16) bytes whose value shall also be 16 - (M mod 16).

The Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode, which requires an initialization vector, is used. The block size parameter is set to 16 bytes, and the initialization vector is a 16-byte random number that is stored as the first 16 bytes of the encrypted stream or string.

summary.para: Represents a cryptographic device that stores cryptographic information and possibly performs cryptographic functions accessible through PKCS#11 application programming interface called "Cryptoki".
Cryptographic device may be implemented as a smart card, smart disk, PCMCIA card, or with some other technology, including software-only.
summary.note: GemBox.Pdf uses Pkcs11Interop to communicate with a cryptographic device from a .NET runtime so your project must reference NuGet package Pkcs11Interop in order to use this class.
After you are finished using make sure you either dispose it or call its method.

member.seealso: Pkcs11Interop
PKCS #11 Cryptographic Token Interface Base Specification Version 3.0
PKCS#11 (Cryptoki) digital signature example

member.name: M:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfPkcs11Module.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a path to the specified PKCS#11 module.
member.param: The path to the PKCS#11 module (usually a .dll).

If set to (recommended option), the PKCS#11 module will be used from multi-threaded application and needs to perform locking with native OS threading model; otherwise, the PKCS#11 module will be used from single-threaded application and does not need to perform any kind of locking.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfPkcs11Token

summary.para: Represents the logical view of a cryptographic device defined by Cryptoki.
Various objects can be stored on a token. These include data, certificates and keys.
Stored objects can be accessed and cryptographic functions performed only after the session (a logical connection between an application and a token) is opened.

member.seealso: PKCS#11 (Cryptoki) digital signature example

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Security.PdfTimestamper

summary.para: Represents a timestamper that gets the TimeStampToken as specified in RFC 3161 as updated by RFC 5816.
The value of the messageImprint field within the TimeStampToken shall be a hash of either:

item.description: the bytes of the signature field within SignerInfo for the CMS-based if the generated timestamp token is included as a unsigned attribute of that SignerInfo (signature timestamp).

the bytes of the document indicated by the ByteRange and the ByteRange shall specify the complete PDF file contents (excepting the value) if the generated timestamp token is included as a content of a signature dictionary (whose Type entry has a value of DocTimeStamp) that is a value of a signature field added as an incremental update (document timestamp).

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.8.3.3 PKCS#7 Signatures as used in ISO 32000'
ETSI EN 319 142-1, section '5.4.3 Document Time-stamp'
PAdES B-T level example
PAdES B-LTA level example

Not supported in the and ( is thrown).
Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by bits , , and .

(Security handlers of revision 2) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).
(Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by bit .
Not supported in the and ( is thrown).
Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if bit is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).
Supported in the and with the following meaning: Permitted changes are the same as for , as well as annotation creation, deletion, and modification; other changes shall invalidate the signature.
(Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if bit is clear.

Supported in the and with the following meaning: Permitted changes shall be filling in forms, instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes shall invalidate the signature. Adding pages with a rarely used technique called spawning page templates is allowed, but not manually adding pages with Tools, Pages, Insert Pages. Only signing by clicking a signature field is allowed, but not via Acrobat's menu items.
(Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).
Not supported in the and ( is thrown).
(Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if bit is clear.
Not supported in the and ( is thrown).

(Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this bit is clear (and bit is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.
Not supported in the and ( is thrown).

member.summary: Represents options used for loading a from a PDF file.
member.seealso: File Structure

member.summary: Gets the default options used for loading any from a PDF file.
member.value: The default options used for loading any from a PDF file.

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfLoadOptions.ReadOnly

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to load a from a read-only PDF file so that changes made to the cannot be saved back to the same PDF file.

When a PDF file is opened in Adobe Acrobat Reader, it will lock the file so no other process can write to the file while it is opened. Use this property to load a from the PDF file in a read-only mode while it is still opened in Adobe Acrobat Reader.
Also, if you want to open a PDF file in Adobe Acrobat Reader while the is loaded from the PDF file and before it is closed, then use this property to load a from a PDF file in a read-only mode.

Note that loading a from a PDF file in a read-only mode (without acquiring an exclusive write lock on the file) might lead to unpredictable behavior if the file is simultaneously changed by another process because the PDF file is read into memory incrementally and lazily. To prevent the unpredictable behavior at the expense of performance, use method to read the entire PDF file into memory.
Default value: .

member.value: to load from a read-only PDF file so that changes made to the cannot be saved back to the same PDF file; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.PdfLoadOptions.Password

summary.para: Gets or sets the password used to load a PDF document from a password-encrypted PDF file.
If PDF file is not encrypted, then this property is ignored.

member.value: The password used to load a PDF document from a password-encrypted PDF file.
member.seealso: Decrypt example

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.PdfObject
member.summary: Represents a base class for all types that implement various PDF components in the GemBox.Pdf assembly.

remarks.para: GemBox.Pdf assembly doesn't publicly expose constructors for types assignable from (except ), , and types. These types are instead instantiated either through Create or other factory methods.

Reasons for this is to support either the current or future extensibility of the type without affecting backward compatibility and without using composition to reduce the number of object allocations.

For example, type is implemented as and PdfReal type. When using method, GemBox.Pdf assembly is able to create either PdfReal or , or return a cached instance of available for an implementation-defined interval of integers, thus reducing memory overhead.
and types have several implementations that reduce the number of byte[] allocations.

type is currently implemented as a dynamic array. In the future, GemBox.Pdf assembly might provide an implementation that is immutable (without a need to use composition) to reduce memory overhead and optimize cloning operation.

type is currently implemented as a hash table with a separate chaining collision resolution. In the future, GemBox.Pdf assembly might provide an implementation that uses dynamic array (without a need to use composition) if number of entries is small, to reduce memory overhead and, potentially, improve performance.
All these current and future implementations would not be possible in a backward compatible way (without unnecessary usage of composition) if constructors were publicly exposed.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.PdfOutline

summary.para: A PDF document may contain a document outline that the conforming reader may display on the screen, allowing the user to navigate interactively from one part of the document to another. The outline consists of a tree-structured hierarchy of outline items (sometimes called bookmarks), which serve as a visual table of contents to display the document’s structure to the user.
represents a single outline item that is a node in the doubly linked list of outline items represented by .

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.PdfPageBoundaryType
member.summary: A PDF page may be prepared either for a finished medium, such as a sheet of paper, or as part of a prepress process in which the content of the page is placed on an intermediate medium, such as film or an imposed reproduction plate. In the latter case, it is important to distinguish between the intermediate page and the finished page. The intermediate page may often include additional production-related content, such as bleeds or printer marks, that falls outside the boundaries of the finished page. To handle such cases, a PDF page may define as many as five separate boundaries to control various aspects of the imaging process:

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PdfPageBoundaryType.MediaBox
member.summary: The media box defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is to be printed. It may include any extended area surrounding the finished page for bleed, printing marks, or other such purposes. It may also include areas close to the edges of the medium that cannot be marked because of physical limitations of the output device. Content falling outside this boundary may safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PdfPageBoundaryType.CropBox
member.summary: The crop box defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed. Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents. However, in the absence of additional information (such as imposition instructions specified in a JDF or PJTF job ticket), the crop box determines how the page’s contents shall be positioned on the output medium.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PdfPageBoundaryType.BleedBox
member.summary: The bleed box (PDF 1.3) defines the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment. This may include any extra bleed area needed to accommodate the physical limitations of cutting, folding, and trimming equipment. The actual printed page may include printing marks that fall outside the bleed box.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PdfPageBoundaryType.TrimBox
member.summary: The trim box (PDF 1.3) defines the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. It may be smaller than the media box to allow for production-related content, such as printing instructions, cut marks, or color bars.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PdfPageBoundaryType.ArtBox
member.summary: The art box (PDF 1.3) defines the extent of the page’s meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the page’s creator.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Bgr101010
member.summary: Bgr101010 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 10 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Bgr24
member.summary: Bgr24 is a sRGB format with 24 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Bgr32
member.summary: Bgr32 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Bgr555
member.summary: Bgr555 is a sRGB format with 16 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 5 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Bgr565
member.summary: Bgr565 is a sRGB format with 16 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (blue, green, and red) is allocated 5, 6, and 5 bits per pixel (BPP) respectively.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Bgra32
member.summary: Bgra32 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (blue, green, red, and alpha) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.BlackWhite
member.summary: Black and white pixel format which displays one bit of data per pixel as either black or white.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Cmyk32
member.summary: Cmyk32 pixel format which displays 32 bits per pixel (BPP) with each color channel (cyan, magenta, yellow, and black) allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Gray16
member.summary: Gray16 pixel format which displays a 16 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 65536 shades of gray. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Gray2
member.summary: Gray2 pixel format which displays a 2 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 4 shades of gray.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Gray32Float
member.summary: Gray32Float displays a 32 bits per pixel (BPP) grayscale channel, allowing over 4 billion shades of gray. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Gray4
member.summary: Gray4 pixel format which displays a 4 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 16 shades of gray.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Gray8
member.summary: Gray8 pixel format which displays an 8 bits-per-pixel grayscale channel, allowing 256 shades of gray.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Pbgra32
member.summary: Pbgra32 is a sRGB format with 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (blue, green, red, and alpha) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is pre-multiplied by the alpha value.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Prgba128Float
member.summary: Prgba128Float is a ScRGB format with 128 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (red, green, blue, and alpha) is allocated 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is pre-multiplied by the alpha value. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Prgba64
member.summary: Prgba64 is a sRGB format with 64 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (blue, green, red, and alpha) is allocated 32 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is pre-multiplied by the alpha value. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Rgb128Float
member.summary: Rgb128Float is a ScRGB format with 128 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is allocated 32 BPP. This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Rgb24
member.summary: Rgb24 is a sRGB format with 24 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (red, green, and blue) is allocated 8 bits per pixel (BPP).

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Rgb48
member.summary: Rgb48 is a sRGB format with 48 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel (red, green, and blue) is allocated 16 bits per pixel (BPP). This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Rgba128Float
member.summary: Rgba128Float is a ScRGB format with 128 bits per pixel (BPP). Each color channel is allocated 32 bits per pixel (BPP). This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.PixelFormat.Rgba64
member.summary: Rgba64 is an sRGB format with 64 bits per pixel (BPP). Each channel (red, green, blue, and alpha) is allocated 16 bits per pixel (BPP). This format has a gamma of 1.0.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolio

summary.para: Specifies how a conforming reader's user interface presents collections of file attachments.
If property of a is not , the conforming reader shall present the document as a PDF Portfolio (also known as portable collection).
The file attachments comprising a PDF Portfolio shall be located in the name tree. All attachments in that tree are in the PDF Portfolio; any attachments not in that tree are not.

When a conforming reader first opens a PDF Portfolio document, it shall display the contents of the , along with a list of the documents present in the name tree. The document list shall include the additional document information specified by the . The initial document may be the container PDF (if is ) or one of the embedded documents.

member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.5 Collections'
Overview of PDF Portfolios
Portfolios example

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolio.Fields
member.summary: Gets the Portfolio fields. If empty, the conforming reader may choose useful defaults that are known to exist in a , such as the file name, file size, and modified date.
member.value: The Portfolio fields.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.5 Collections'
Portfolios example

member.name: P:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolio.InitialFile

summary.para: (Optional) The embedded file that shall be initially presented in the user interface. If the is or is not a valid , the initial file shall be the current document (PDF Portfolio). If the is valid and does not match any file in the name tree, the interactive PDF processor shall select the first item from the list of files to display in its user interface; if no files exist in the name tree, the interactive PDF processor shall display an empty preview window.
(PDF 2.0) For unencrypted wrapper documents for an encrypted payload document the is required, and shall identify the encrypted payload entry in the name tree.

member.value: The embedded file that shall be initially presented in the user interface.
member.exception: The is not in the PDF Portfolio (not contained in the ).
member.remarks: When setting a value this property performs a linear search in the to find a key associated with the that is to be set; therefore, it is an O(n) operation, where n is count.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.5 Collections'
Portfolios example

summary.para: Gets the sort levels by which files and folders in the are sorted.

If multiple files and folders in the have the same value for the field specified by the first level in the collection, the values for fields specified by the successive levels in the collection shall be used for sorting, until a unique order is determined or until the sort levels are exhausted.

member.summary: Represents the orientation of the splitter bar.

member.summary: The value is unknown and currently not supported.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioSplitDirection.Horizontal
member.summary: The window is split horizontally.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioSplitDirection.Vertical
member.summary: The window is split vertically.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioSplitDirection.None
member.summary: The window is not split. The entire window region shall be dedicated to the file navigation view.

member.name: T:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType
member.summary: Represens a view or the layout of a navigator.
member.seealso: PDF Specification ISO 32000-1:2008, section '12.3.5 Collections'

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.Custom
member.summary: The has a navigator with the custom layout.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.Details
member.summary: The shall be presented in details mode, with all information in the dictionary presented in a multi-column format. This mode provides the most information to the user.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.Tile
member.summary: The shall be presented in tile mode, with each file in the Portfolio denoted by a small icon and a subset of information from the dictionary. This mode provides top-level information about the file attachments to the user.

summary.para: The shall be initially hidden. The interactive PDF processor shall provide means for the user to view the Portfolio by some explicit action. The PDF processor should display the document specified by the property.
summary.note: How the PDF processor chooses to display the is implementation specific.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.FilmStrip
member.summary: (PDF 2.0) A layout which displays a strip of thumbnails, providing an index to the file attachments within the . The selected attachment should be previewed alongside the index.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.FreeForm
member.summary: (PDF 2.0) A layout which places thumbnails of the file attachments within the randomly in the view.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.Linear
member.summary: (PDF 2.0) A layout which provides a large size preview of one file attachment in the and displays alongside the metadata for the file attachment, including the name, description and other entries.

member.name: F:GemBox.Pdf.Portfolios.PdfPortfolioViewType.Tree
member.summary: (PDF 2.0) A layout presenting the contents of the in a tree view, showing the folder structure and the files as leaf nodes of the tree, akin to a traditional file system folder view.
